content.description: Biologists conducted a study to investigate the flying velocity of mosquitoes both before and after feeding. The following scatterplot shows the velocity after feeding, in centimeters per second, and the proportional increase in weight after feeding relative to the weight before feeding. For example, 0.5 indicates a 50 percent weight gain after feeding. One point on the graph is labeled <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.
content.question: What is unusual about point <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: It represents a mosquito that gained the least weight after feeding.
It represents a mosquito that gained the most weight after feeding.
It represents a mosquito that flew very fast after feeding relative to all other mosquitoes.
It makes the linear relationship between the variables appear much stronger.
The point must be an error in data entry because weight cannot be less than 0.

content.answer: It represents a mosquito that flew very fast after feeding relative to all other mosquitoes.

topic.text: 2.4: Representing the Relationship Between Two Quantitative Variables

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Describe data presented numerically or graphically.
